unit_learning_outcomes.description: Convey a sound knowledge of the theory, concepts, and principles in solid mechanics
Perform qualitative and quantitative structural analysis and structural behaviour of different vertical and lateral loads
Report the structural analysis process and outcomes to a professional standard in both oral and written forms
Analyse reactions, axial forces, bending moments, shear forces, deflection, and stresses in structural elements and systems

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Class preparation for tutorials and practical class

assessments.description: Report on practical work completed, including written and oral report.
Students will be provided with regular problem sets to complete. Five in total
Final examination assessing content throughout semester

data.description: In this unit, students will be introduced to different aspects of mechanics of solids and structural analysis of trusses, beams and frames. This provides the students with the skills to analyse structures as a foundation skill to different structural designs. Students will develop their understanding of the physical performance of solid structural members, which are associated with a variety of structural systems in Civil Engineering. They also gain an understanding of the theory and application of structural analysis as it applies to trusses, beams and frames. Specific topics include basic concept of deformation compatibility; stresses and strains in structural elements, states of stress such as shear, bending, and torsion, displacements and deformations, energy methods for bar and beam structures; simple buckling; deformation of simple frames and cell box beams, response of linear elastic structures under different mechanical and environmental effects, and structural behaviour considering the distribution of internal forces.
data.title: Structural Analysis

title: Structural Analysis
